p: Vector-borne diseases are transmitted by vectors and epidemics of these diseases are expected to occur following massive flooding ( Okaka and Odhiambo, 2018; Paterson et al., 2018). Weather changes have a great impact on vector-borne diseases and insect population. Previous studies have shown the association of monsoon rains and floods with outbreaks of dengue fever in India and Thailand ( Ivers and Ryan, 2006).
